decision_conditions: 1.  The consent shall expire after 5 years from the date of this notice.

2.  Any advertisements displayed, and any site used for the display of advertisements, shall be maintained in a clean and tidy condition to the reasonable satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority.
3.  Any structure or hoarding erected or used principally for the purpose of displaying advertisements shall be maintained in a safe condition.
4.  Where an advertisement is required under these Regulations to be removed, the removal shall be carried out to the reasonable satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority.
5.  No advertisement is to be displayed without the permission of the owner of the site or any other person with an interest in the site entitled to grant permission.

6.  No advertisement shall be sited or displayed so as to obscure, or hinder the ready interpretation of, any road traffic sign, railway signal or aid to navigation by water or air, or so as otherwise to render hazardous the use of any highway, waterway (including any coastal waters) or aerodrome (civil or military).

Note: These are imposed automatically unless expressly varied, for instance the time limit shortened. | The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: UWLSM-BBA-ZZ-00-D-A-9001 P01, SMRF-BBA-ZZ-00-D-A-7502 P05, Jakob rope systems from MMA Architectural Systems Ltd  specification sheet.
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning. | The existing projecting brick pattern on the southern elevation must be retained and maintained.

Reason: To protect the historical signficance of the locally listed building in accordance with London Plan Policy HC1 and Local Plan Policy 7C. | The illumination of the sign(s)/advertisement(s) shall comply with the recommendations of the Institution of Lighting Professionals in their guidance document PLG05 Brightness of Illuminated Advertisements, 2015, including the following operational features:
- Static images to be displayed only (no moving or flashing images);
- Maximum level of illuminance to be set to 300cd/m2 (more than 10m2) and 600 cd/m2  (no more than 10m2) in accordance with ILP Guidelines

Reason:   To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by artificial lighting, in accordance with policies D4 and D6 of the London Plan (2021) and policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).
description: Installation of 2no. internally illuminated fascia signs, 1no. externally illuminated university logo sign, and construction of a suspended green wall (Advertisement Consent).
